column1: ! The naming convention for CLIM_ID indicates the climate models/data used to generate the scenario, the type of downscaling approach applied, and the type of scenario represented. Each ID is made up of 4-characters which are defined below.
! Additional values may also be introduced according to the participation/inclusion of new methods for scenario generation and requested scenarios.
! First character indicates time period and emissions scenario (additional values will be generated to indicate CMIP5 RCP simulations)
! Second character is GCM/data source (here listed as CMIP3, subject to change for CMIP5):
! Fourth character is Type of Scenario:

column3: Mean Change from GCM modified by RCM
Mean and daily variability change for Tmax, Tmin, and P
P, Tmax and Tmin daily variability change only
Tmax and Tmin daily variability and mean change only
P daily variability and mean change pm;y
Tmax and Tmin daily variability change only
